intro: Riedelia marafungensis, commonly known as the Marafungensis riedelia, is a flowering plant native to the humid regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with hairy stems and lobed leaves. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom during the warm season and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Riedelia marafungensis is often found in shaded, moist environments, such as forest understories or along stream banks.
